Should the narratives of police reports, particularly Stop and Frisk documentation, be subject to independent review?

Submitted by ansondparker on Sun, 02/01/2015 - 12:11
What's up?: 
Should the narratives of police reports, particularly Stop and Frisk documentation, be subject to independent review, and if so, by who?
Deadline: 
Sunday, February 1, 2015 - 12:00 to Monday, February 2, 2015 - 19:00
Location Map: 
Background: 
In June 2014 Council received a report from the Disproportionate Minority Contact(DMC) in the Juvenile Justice System Task Force and subsequently held a work session.
Alignment with Council Vision Areas and Strategic Plan: 
Community of Mutual Respect
None
Staff Contacts: 
Mike Murphy
Gretchen Ellis
Rory Carpenter
Action Required:

Ending the Observance of Robert E. Lee/Thomas “Stonewall” Jackson Holiday

Submitted by ansondparker on Sat, 01/31/2015 - 12:39
What's up?: 
City council is weighing in on the continued observance of Lee & Jackson. Many cities in Virginia have cancelled this observance for rather obvious reasons.
Deadline: 
Saturday, January 31, 2015 - 12:15 to Tuesday, February 17, 2015 - 18:00
Location Map: 
Background: 
There is a long and complex history associated with the observance of the birthdays of former Confederate Generals Robert E. Lee and Thomas “Stonewall” Jackson in the state of Virginia.
Alignment with Council Vision Areas and Strategic Plan: 
Community of Mutual Respect
There is no budgetary impact.
Staff Contacts: 
Maurice Jones
Action Required: 
Approval of Resolution

Monday, January 19, 2015 - 12:00 to Tuesday, January 20, 2015 - 12:00
Location Map: 
Background: 
The Charlottesville Department of Social Services has received an additional $12,675 to purchase job training and employment support services for participants in the Virginia Initiative for Employment
Alignment with Council Vision Areas and Strategic Plan: 
A Center for Lifelong Learning
A Connected Community
Community of Mutual Respect
Economic Sustainability
The funds have been received and will be appropriated into the Department of Social Services Fund.
Staff Contacts:

Adoption Incentive Funds- $2,977.92

Submitted by ansondparker on Mon, 01/19/2015 - 12:00
What's up?: 
Department of Social Services wants to purchase resources for adoptive parents, celebrate with adoptive parents during adoption finalization, and host post adoption workshops for adoptive families. $1,500 of the funds will be used to partner with Albemarle County D.S.S. to provide 4 post adoption workshops for adoptive parents.
Deadline: 
Monday, January 19, 2015 - 12:00 to Tuesday, January 20, 2015 - 12:00
Location Map: 
Background: 
The Virginia Department of Social Services makes adoption incentive funding available to local Departments of Social Services to purchase resources for adoptive parents, celebrate with adoptive parent
Alignment with Council Vision Areas and Strategic Plan: 
Community of Mutual Respect
Economic Sustainability
Smart, Citizen-Focused Government
The funds have been received and will be appropriated into the Department of Social Services Fund.
Staff Contacts: 
Diane Kuknyo
Laura Morris
Action Required: 
Approve Appropriation

Submitted by ansondparker on Sat, 01/17/2015 - 11:52
What's up?:

Deadline: 
Saturday, January 17, 2015 - 11:45 to Monday, February 2, 2015 - 11:45
Location Map: 
Background: 
The Thomas Jefferson Area Crisis Intervention Program provides regular training courses for Law Enforcement and other agencies, both local and from throughout the state.
Staff Contacts:

V.D.O.T. Funds for the Condemnation of C.A.T.E.C. Property Used for the Meadowcreek Parkway - $144,700

Submitted by ansondparker on Wed, 01/14/2015 - 13:32
What's up?: 
The Charlottesville City School Board and the Albemarle County Schools Board each received a check in the amount of $144,700 V.D.O.T. for its share of compensation for the condemnation of 2.75 acres of the 15 acre C.A.T.E.C. property.
Deadline: 
Wednesday, January 14, 2015 - 13:30 to Tuesday, February 3, 2015 - 13:30
Location Map: 
Background: 
The Charlottesville City School Board and the Albemarle County Schools Board each received a check in the amount of $144,700 from the Virginia Department of Transportation (V.D.O.T.) for its share of
The condemnation funds, a total of $144,700, will be appropriated into a reserve capital budget account, the use of which will be determined through future C.A.T.E.C. C.I.P. requests.
Staff Contacts: 
Maurice Jones
Leslie Beauregard
Action Required: 
Approve Appropriation
